DataElement.preferredName: Person Transplant Conditioning Dose Adjustment Weight Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the dose adjusted weight value, the vertical force exerted by the mass of an individual as a result of gravity adjusted for dose requirements, of a transplant recipient  to determine the administered dose of high doses of chemotherapy or radiation therapy, as well as immunosuppressive therapy, prior to a bone marrow or hematopoietic stem cell transplant (conditioning destroys the patient's abnormal blood cells or cancer, as well as slows the patient's immune response against the donor bone marrow (graft rejection)).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Transplant Conditioning Dose Adjustment Weight
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the dose adjusted weight, the vertical force exerted by the mass of an individual as a result of gravity adjusted for dose requirements, of a transplant recipient  to determine the administered dose of high doses of chemotherapy or radiation therapy, as well as immunosuppressive therapy, prior to a bone marrow or hematopoietic stem cell transplant (conditioning destroys the patient's abnormal blood cells or cancer, as well as slows the patient's immune response against the donor bone marrow (graft rejection)).

Property.preferredDefinition:
Administration of high doses of chemotherapy or radiation therapy, as well as immunosuppressive therapy,
to a transplant.:The amount of medicine taken, or radiation given, at one time.:The act of making necessary corrections or modifications.:The vertical force exerted by a mass as a result of gravity.

Concepts.definition: Administration of high doses of chemotherapy or radiation therapy, as well as immunosuppressive therapy, to a transplant recipient prior to a bone marrow or hematopoietic stem cell transplant.  Conditioning destroys the patient's abnormal blood cells or cancer, as well as slows the patient's immune response against the donor bone marrow (graft rejection).
A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.
The act of making necessary corrections or modifications.
The vertical force exerted by a mass as a result of gravity.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The numerical result of the determination of the vertical force exerted by the mass of an individual as a result of gravity.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: general description of an individual's physical appearance and vital status.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The vertical force exerted by a mass as a result of gravity.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: The vertical force exerted by a mass as a result of gravity.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
